title: Using phone as hotspot - taking SO MUCH DATA
body:
My friend has been recently using his phone for a hotspot to play League since he can't afford internet. When first started, which was a couple of months ago, each game would take around half a gig. Now when he plays it's taking over an entire gig. I checked his computer to see if he had any background programs running but everything seemed fine. I looked on the forums and I found that people were playing games while using data nowhere near close to the data that's been used by him (other people were playing games with 40-100 mb of data usage on each game).

He plays on a laptop (if that helps get any clues). Any suggestions on what to do?

replies.body:
League should typically take anywhere between 50-100MB per match, depending on game mode, length of the match and the number of actions taken in the match. I recommend your friend 100% ensure no background apps are consuming data by [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) before hopping into a match to test usage.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
Just to elaborate a bit, maybe the problems are background apps **on the phone**, not on the laptop?
